exp: Reaction stoichiometry: 2H2 + O2 → 2H2O. 2 moles H2 produce 2 moles H2O, so 4 moles H2 produce 4 moles H2O.

exp: Reaction stoichiometry: 2H2 + O2 → 2H2O. 2 moles H2 produce 2 moles H2O, so 4 moles H2 produce 4 moles H2O.

subject: Chemistry
q: A weak acid HA has Ka = 0.000172 and initial concentration 0.02 M. Using approximation, what is the hydrogen ion concentration [H+]?
exp: For weak acid HA, [H+] ≈ sqrt(Ka×c) = sqrt(0.000172×0.02) ≈ 0.001855 M.
